metadata.Title: CVE-2016-8647 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.Description:
An input validation vulnerability was found in Ansible's mysql_user module before 2.2.1.0, which may fail to correctly change a password in certain circumstances. Thus the previous password would still be active when it should have been changed.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2016-8647` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ansible - 2.6.1+dfsg-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> fails on mysql forks percona 5.7 and newer, all mariadb

criterions.comment: ansible package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.6.1+dfsg-1').
